IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Victor Treatment Centers, Inc.'s mission "is to be a catalyst for sustained improvement in the lives of those we touch." Victor Treatment Centers, Inc. is a 24-hour residential treatment facility for severely emotionally disturbed and mentally ill minors. Victor receives most of its funding from county and state agencies, with certain portions of its funding originating from the federal government.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Victor Treatment Centers, Inc operates four highly intensive residential treatment programs. These "level 14" programs treat children and adolescents who have experienced multiple treatment failures and are the most resistive to treatment. VTC emphasizes a home-like, non-institutional environment where residential staff teaches children the skills they need to overcome emotional difficulties.
IRS990.Description: Residential Care - VTC, Inc is a 24-hour residential treatment facility for severely, emotionally disturbed and mentally ill minors. VTC has programs established in Shasta, San Joaquin, Sonoma, San Bernardino and Riverside Counties.

Activity2.Description: Mental Health Services - Paramount to the VTC philosophy is the belief that mental health clients should be treated in the least restrictive community-based setting possible. Clients are children and adolescents who have experienced multiple placement failures and are the most resistive to treatment.

Activity3.Description: Residential Based Services is a pilot program which will provide effective and reliable interim resources designed to facilitate the ongoing movement of children and youth who have complex emotional and behavioral needs.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Part XI, line 8: Transfer of assets to related company - $(821,671)

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Victor Treatment Centers, Inc. has adopted a non-qualified deferred compensation plan. Amounts allocated to participants will be held in trust for the participants.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Administrative Services were moved to a related organization, Victor Community Support Services, Inc.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Douglas Scott, CEO is married to Debra Scott, Director of Marketing and Program Development in a related organization, Victor Community Support Services.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the Form 990 is provided to the governing body before it is filed. The draft Form 990 is reviewed by a sub-committee of the Board of Directors with agency staff and the agency audit firm which prepares the Form 990. Any questions are discussed and resolved. After this review, the Form 990 is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each year, the Board of Directors reviews the conflict of interest policy and has each Board member sign a document that either discloses any possible conflict of interest or states no such relationship exists. Any related party transactions are also reviewed and discussed as part of the independent audit. Any actual or potential conflicts are discussed and decisions made related to their appropriateness.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CEO Compensation is benchmarked related to overall percentage of revenues as compared to other California organizations in the same industry. This comparison is documented and presented to the Board of Directors for review and approval at a closed session of a Board meeting. Minutes of the review are approved, recorded and maintained. Other Officers or Key Employees: On an annual basis the compensation for the 5 highest paid executives is compared to industry benchmarks using information from the annual GuideStar compensation report. Compensation levels for comparable positions are made by region as well as organization size. Documents are presented to the Board of Directors for review and approval at a closed session of a Board meeting. Minutes of the review are approved, recorded and maintained.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public in two (2) ways. All such documents and statements are available upon request. The Form 990 is filed with the Internal Revenue Service and the California Franchise tax board making these documents public. The organization's Form 990's are available on the Guidestar website at www.guidestar.org.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Compensation of Officers, Directors, Trustees, Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: There exists a difference between Form W-2 compensation for David Favor on Form 990 Part VII. ($1,619,763) and Victor's general ledger salary expense for David Favor ($508,829) included in the Total "Management and general expenses" on Form 990, Part IX, line C5. The difference is $1,110,936 and represents taxable retirement benefits paid to David Favor. David Favor's Form W-2 Compensation consists of the following: $508,827 regular taxable compensation $1,110,936 one time payment of taxable deferred compensation benefits Victor adopted a non-qualified deferred compensation plan which became effective in the year ended June 30, 1989. Amounts allocated to plan participants are held in trust for the participants. The funding for the above payment came from a trust established for the non-qualified deferred compensation plan.

Form990ScheduleRPartIV.PrimaryActivity: Operate as group workers comp self insurance program
